title: Formatting removes fully qualified cmdlet names
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.104.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100

When using the Microsoft PowerShell extension in Visual Studio Code, I’ve noticed that it automatically removes fully qualified cmdlet names in PowerShell scripts during formatting or code generation. Specifically, it strips the ModuleName\ prefix from cmdlets, which can lead to ambiguous behavior or incorrect module resolution—especially in environments where multiple modules define cmdlets with the same name.

🔁 Steps to Reproduce

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a PowerShell script with a fully qualified cmdlet, e.g.:

Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility\Get-Date

2.Format the document (SHIFT-ALT-F)

3. Observe that the cmdlet is changed to:

Get-Date

⚠️ Expected Behavior
PowerShell formatter should preserve the fully qualified cmdlet name (ModuleName\Cmdlet) to ensure correct module scoping and avoid ambiguity.

❌ Actual Behavior
Formatter removes the module prefix, resulting in:

powershell
Get-Date
This can cause:

Incorrect cmdlet resolution if multiple modules define Get-Date

Loss of explicit module context

Potential runtime errors in scripts

Modules not being auto imported and causing command-not-found errors

💻 Environment
VS Code Version: 1.104..0-insider
PowerShell Extension Version: : 2025.2.0 + 2025.3.1

📎 Additional Notes
Disabling Format On Save helps avoid the issue, but this is not ideal.

title: Add sound notification when process stops (macOS: use 'say' command option)
body:
## Feature Request

When a process or task stops, play a sound notification so users who are not actively looking at the window know to return. On macOS, provide an option to use the `say` command to announce what needs approval, in addition to a simple beep.

### Requirements
- Add a user preference to choose between a beep or a spoken message using the `say` command.
- Spoken message should announce what needs approval when using `say`.
- Default to beep on platforms other than macOS, unless a similar feature is possible.
- The notification should trigger only when user attention is needed.

### Rationale
This helps users who may be multitasking or away from the window to be promptly notified when their action is required, improving UX for approval flows and long-running tasks.

### Example:
- On macOS: `say "Copilot Chat needs your approval to continue."`
- On other platforms: trigger a beep or native sound.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Option in preferences for sound notification type (beep/say)
- [ ] Sound notification reliably triggers at process stop or when approval is needed
- [ ] Works cross-platform (with graceful fallback)
- [ ] Spoken message is customizable on macOS



The main place where the code "stops to ask the user to 'continue'" is in the function `completionCutOrContinue` in [`src/extension/completions/common/parseBlock.ts`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/6188f5d6dfd486043f86e2b727b5e0c26b4cfa4e/src/extension/completions/common/parseBlock.ts):

```typescript
export function completionCutOrContinue(
  completion: string,
  contextIndentation: ContextIndentation,
  previewText: string | undefined
): number | 'continue' {
  // ...logic...
  if (completionLines.length === startLine) {
    // A single line that did not yet end.
    return 'continue';
  }
  // ...more logic...
  return 'continue'; // If none of the ending conditions are met
}
```
- This function analyzes the completion context and determines if the completion should end or prompt the user to "continue" (i.e., more input is needed).
- It returns either an offset (where to cut the completion) or the string `'continue'` when the context isn't finished.

Other related logic:
- In the tool-calling loop ([src/extension/intents/node/toolCallingLoop.ts](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/6188f5d6dfd486043f86e2b727b5e0c26b4cfa4e/src/extension/intents/node/toolCallingLoop.ts#L311-L321)), after hitting a tool call limit, the user is asked if Copilot should "Continue to iterate?".
- The agent prompt ([src/extension/prompts/node/agent/agentPrompt.tsx](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/6188f5d6dfd486043f86e2b727b5e0c26b4cfa4e/src/extension/prompts/node/agent/agentPrompt.tsx)) also contains instructions for when the agent should keep going or stop.

**Summary:**  
The most direct code stop for "continue" is in `completionCutOrContinue` within `parseBlock.ts`, with supporting logic in the tool-calling loop and agent prompt instructions. This is where the code determines that the user's input or completion is not finished, and signals for continuation.

title: Stuttering in VS Code on AMD Radeon 780M (Zephyrus G14 2025) when GPU acceleration is enabled
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->

<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 
- OS Version: 

Description:

VS Code stutters/freezes briefly when switching tabs or scrolling.
Happens only with hardware acceleration enabled (enable-gpu-rasterization).
Disabling hardware acceleration via argv.json fixes the issue.
GPU: AMD Radeon 780M, driver 24.30.62.03-250626a-417106C-Asus.
OS: Windows 11 24H2.

dxgkrnl.sys and wdf01000.sys spike in LatencyMon during stutter.

Steps to Reproduce:

1 .Set "enable-gpu-rasterization": true in argv.json.
2 .Restart VS Code.
3. Switch tabs or scroll.
4. Stuttering occurs.

Workaround:
Adding "disable-hardware-acceleration": true to argv.json removes stutter.

title: Outline: Sort by type, then by position (or secondary sort config)

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
There was an issue created to sort the Outline by Type and then by Name:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/62069

However, I don't know why we don't have it as sort by Type and then by **Position**. It is an outline after all, like a table of contents:
I have comments on my code that organize the code in sections and it is nice to see where it is in the document easily by position (and click into the corresponding section). Maybe we can have a configuration for this to change the secondary sort to either Name or Position.

title: Misleading option title when creating a Git branch

labels.name: git
labels.description: GIT issues

labels.name: under-discussion
labels.description: Issue is under discussion for relevance, priority, approach

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled? **Yes.**

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: `1.104.0-insider`
- OS Version: macOS `15.6`

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a folder tracked with Git
2. Click on the _Source Control Checkout_ button in the bottom Status Bar
3. Enter a new branch name
4. Click on _Create new branch..._
    **The three dots indicate that there will be another step before creation.** See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/uxguide/cmd-menus#using-ellipses

### Expected

Another step before the branch is created.

### What happens

There is no other step—the branch is immediately created.

title: Agent mode does nonsensical things
body:
Type: Bug I have been trying to do some very normal requests all morning using Copilot Chat and several models. All of them return nonsensical responses or fail to give a response since the latest update. I'ts absolutely desperating. Here I include one screenshot of an example, but it doesn't matter what I do, it just does not work, and it does not matter which model I use either, happens with Claude, Gemini and GPT-5. Before the August 15 update it was working fine. I paste an image with an example. Here I just asked to make a jupyter notebook out of a python script, it decided to make a jupyter notebook with one cell that wraps the script. I then asked it to please make the notebook, and it made an empty notebook. This is on default settings, just one example out of a whole morning of trying different things with all sorts of nonsense output. I also tried directly on the remote machine, with the same results. This needs to be fixed ASAP because it is completely unusable. Edit: testing things a bit more, it seems like the ask mode is alright. It answers quickly and things make sense. but Agent and Edit mode, as well as the inline editor mode, are completely unusable. Extension version: 0.30.1 VS Code version: Code 1.103.1 (360a4e4fd251bfce169a4ddf857c7d25d1ad40da, 2025-08-12T16:25:40.542Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes: Remote OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100

title: Copilot Inline Chat: Unrecoverable Text Area Size
body: - Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.30.1 - VS Code Version:1.103.1 - OS Version:Windows11 - Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): - Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): - Logs: Steps to Reproduce: 1.Open two files side-by-side in the VS Code window. 2. In one file, invoke Copilot inline chat. 2.Input 3 lines of arbitrary characters into the inline chat text area, filling it. 4. Drag the other file's window towards the file with inline chat, making the inline chat's file window (and the chat itself) smaller. 3.Drag the other file's window away from the inline chat's file, expanding the inline chat's file window. 4.Observe that the Copilot inline chat's text area remains compressed and does not revert to its original size (this issue is probabilistic). may be it is caused from https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/workbench/contrib/inlineChat/browser/inlineChatZoneWidget.ts the _onWidth function from in the file

Merge first:

title: Fix: clear duplicate-casing errors after case-only file renames on Windows (closes #261995)
body: On case-insensitive file systems (Windows for example) renaming a file by only changing its letter-case ~ for example `page1.js` => `Page1.js` ~ confuses `tsserver`. It continues to hold both casings in the program and surfaces errors such as: The error persists until the user manually restarts the TS server or reloads VS Code (see bug #261995). ### RCA File-watcher stacks don’t always emit a delete => create sequence for a case-only rename on case-insensitive FSs. `tsserver` therefore never drops the old path and thinks the file is duplicated. ### Testing * Verified on Windows 11. ### Files changed * `extensions/typescript-language-features/src/languageFeatures/updatePathsOnRename.ts` * `extensions/typescript-language-features/src/typeScriptServiceClientHost.ts` --- Closes #261995

```
"code_scanning_upload": {
    "limit": 5000,
    "used": 1029,
    "remaining": 3971,
    "reset": 1755443661
},
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open vscode with any code folder.
2. Enable Copilot extension.
3. Check the rate limit from `https://api.github.com/rate_limit` 
4. It fires 10 code scanning update request per second in an idle vscode instance.
5. The requests didn't shown in vscode dev tool console or network tab.
6. This quickly exhaust the GitHub API 5000 requests per hour limit if I open multiple projects.
7.  This dramatically affect my work, cannot interact with GitHub just 10-15 mins after the limit reset. 
8. This can be verified that the Copilot extension is the cause as disabling/uninstalling the extension stopped the `used` counter raising immediately.

title: GPT-5 mini incorrectly treated as premium model in VS Code
body: I am using GitHub Copilot in VS Code and noticed that when I select "GPT-5 mini (Preview)" from the model menu, I receive a message stating: "You have exceeded your premium request allowance. We have automatically switched you to GPT-4.1 which is included with your plan. Enable additional paid premium requests to continue using premium models." However, the model selector does not indicate that GPT-5 mini is a premium model (no "1x" or similar indicator), and documentation suggests it should be available without premium credits. Steps to Reproduce: Open VS Code with GitHub Copilot enabled. Select "GPT-5 mini (Preview)" from the model menu. Attempt to use Copilot. Observe the premium usage warning and automatic switch to GPT-4.1. What I’ve Tried: Reloaded VS Code and the extension. Signed out and back in. Cleared the extension cache (globalStorage). Checked for extension updates. Expected Behavior: GPT-5 mini should be available without premium usage warnings or restrictions. Actual Behavior: Premium usage warning appears, and Copilot switches to GPT-4.1. Environment: OS: Windows VS Code version: 1.103.1 Copilot extension version: latest Date: August 17, 2025

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: When I disable extensions, Ctrl+L does not delete the line, it only selects it.

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->

### A Bug Found in VS Code

### Summary

After cutting text with **Ctrl+X**, the clipboard content changes when you then delete the same line with **Ctrl+L**.

---

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Open VS Code and create a text file with two or more lines of text.
2.  Select the text on the top line, for example, and cut it by pressing `Ctrl+X`. (The clipboard should now contain the cut text.)
3.  Delete the current line by pressing `Ctrl+L`.
4.  Go to a blank line and paste the content by pressing `Ctrl+V`.
5. You will see that the text pasted from the clipboard is not the same as the text you originally cut.

---

### Additional Info

- VS Code Version: 1.103.1
- Commit: 360a4e4fd251bfce169a4ddf857c7d25d1ad40da
- Date: 2025-08-12T16:25:40.542Z

title: Showing error when case of the imported file name is changed
body:
Type: Bug Whenever we import a file lets say "page1.js" and if we change the case of this file by making first letter to upper case, then it shows error in import statement even after correcting the file name in the import statement. We need to reload or restart VScode to clear the error. This issue has been there for a long time, please fix it next release.
